Key Arguments: The legislation is open-ended and could be misused by those enforcing it.
It is unnecessary in a democratic country and could lead to autocratic rule.
The legislation could lead to censorship of political opinions.
The perception of misinformation changes over time, making enforcement problematic.
The legislation could damage democracy by stifling debate and discussion.
Notable Quotes: This legislation does not belong in a democratic country.
In layman terms this legislation leads into censorship.
There is far more need of balancing accountability of governments to the electorate.
